sub_title: ISS Payload Integration Manager at ESA-ESTEC
summary:
Space Engineer graduated at “La Sapienza” University of Rome, Italy. 

September 2020 - current. Payload Integration Management Engineer for the International Space Station at ESA-ESTEC

- April 2017 - August-2020. Multi-Increment Palyload Planning Engineer for the International Space Station at ESA-ESTEC

- July 2018 - Obtained a PhD in Civil Engineering and Space Geodesy at the Nottingham Geospatial Institute, Nottingham University, about Global Navigation Satellite Systems for Civil Aviation

- November 2013 - November 2016: Marie Curie Early Stage Researcher at the Institute for Aerospace Technology, University of Nottingham. 
Navigation Engineer of "The systematic Integration of Novel Technologies (INNOVATE)" project, European Union's Seventh Framework Programme.
Main tasks and objectives:
- Investigated critical aspects to safe aircraft operations in GNSS denied situations.
- Analysed and tested the integrity performance of Multi-GNSS ARAIM algorithm for Civil Manned applications
- Design and development of user Algorithms integrating ARAIM techniques for integrity performance prediction

- On December 2012 graduated in Space Transportation Systems (Second Level Master's Degree, "La Sapienza" University of Rome). 
Thesis: Internship at EADS Astrium about Kalman Filtering for High-Precision Attitude Estimation.

- On January 2012 graduated in Space Engineering (Master's Degree, "La Sapienza" University of Rome).
Specialisation: Flight Dynamics (Orbital Mechanics and Attitude Dynamics), Mission Analysis, Orbit and Attitude Determination,  programming languages like Fortran, Matlab and C.
Yhesis topic: Effects of different types of Troposheric Mapping Function on GNSS estimate software performances. The software (NDA) was developed by the italian company GalileianPlus.

- On September 2008 graduated in Aerospace Engineering (Bachelor's Degree).
Thesis: analysis of the interplanetary trajectory of a manned mission on Mars with a Nuclear Electric propulsor (NEP) presented to the International Astronautical Congress (IAC) 2009

- Lead and managed a team of two researchers for the development of a physical demonstrator', 'title': 'Marie Curie Fellow', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2734, 'name': 'Airbus', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQF2j_LDG_TOzg/company-logo_400_400/0/1529051939639?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=zPJLIA3neIVb4Tqdfrn85jaAySkpaL5JN8xOZASAF0U', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/airbusgroup/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'EADS Astrium Friedrichshafen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Airbus', 'description': 'Development of process and algorithms for optimality and consistency of 3-D attitude estimation filters considering time-variant misalignment between Star Trackers (STR) and Gyros, due to thermal distortions that often occurs in missions with repetitive eclipse and sun phases.

Star Trackers and Gyros have a number of complementary proprieties which makes them interesting for sensors data fusion. E.g. while a STR provides low-frequent long-term stable attitude measurements, the attitude computed from high-frequent Gyro measurement is only short-term stable. The motivation to fuse STR and Gyro is to generate long-term stable attitude estimate at Gyro measurement frequency of attenuated noise compared to the STR measurement and to optimally bridge periods where no ST measurement is available.
We supposed that the thermal distortion acts only on the Gyros system introducing two new variables that influence the mutual positions of the two sensors and so an error in the attitude estimation; these variables are the misalignment, angle between the nominal Gyros frame position and the modified, and the misalignment rate, angular rate of the U frame (Gyros) respect to the B frame (Body) expressed in the U frame. The whole system is simulated in Matlab Simulink and divided in three main subsystems: Star Tracker measurements simulator, Gyros measurements simulator and the Kalman Filter
The state estimate is computed and compared using three different Kalman filters:
1)Standard Kalman Filter (SKF)
2)Extended Kalman Filter (EKF): uses an augmented state vector, including and estimating the two new variables
3)Consider Kalman Filter (CKF): this type of filter doesn’t estimate the new variable directly, instead update the state estimates and covariance based on an estimated parameter covariance

The observability matrix has been evaluated for all the systems.
The performance parameters for the comparison of the three systems will be the accuracy and the simulation time.', 'title': 'Internship', 'employment_type': None}]}]
